<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage266"></A>
<A NAME="D88742DEX1028_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_7"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.28
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	UNIVAR CANADA LTD.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	SUPPLEMENTAL
	BENEFITS PLAN
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	AMENDED AND RESTATED AS OF JUNE 1, 2007
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Purpose
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The purpose in establishing the Supplemental Benefits Plan (&#147;Plan&#148;)
	is to provide retirement benefits to specifically designated participants of the Univar Canada Ltd. Pension Plan (&#147;Pension Plan&#148;) under the terms of that Pension Plan without regard to limitations on benefits imposed under
	Section&nbsp;147.1(2) of the Income Tax Act and Regulation 8504 which apply to the Pension Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For purposes of this Supplemental
	Benefits Plan, any terms specifically defined in the Pension Plan shall have the same meaning in this Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Effective Date
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Plan was established effective June&nbsp;25, 1993 and was amended
	effective May&nbsp;7, 1996. The Plan was also restated effective May&nbsp;7, 1996,&nbsp;August&nbsp;15, 1997 and July&nbsp;1, 2002. The effective date of this amended and restated Plan is June&nbsp;1, 2007.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Participation
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Plan shall include only those employees of the Company who
	(i)&nbsp;are eligible to receive a benefit under the Pension Plan; (ii)&nbsp;have benefits affected by the limitation on benefits payable from the Pension Plan; (iii)&nbsp;are working for the Company in Canada and are neither U.S. citizens nor U.S.
	residents; and (iv)&nbsp;have been specifically designated to participate in this Plan by the Pension Management Committee of Univar Canada Ltd. (&#147;Company&#148;). Such an employee shall be referred to hereinafter as a &#147;Participant&#148;.
	An employee&#146;s designation as a Participant may be revoked at any time by the Pension Management Committee. Upon such revocation, the employee shall be entitled only to those benefits that may have accrued and become vested under the Plan at the
	time of such revocation. Employees of the Company who are citizens or residents of the United States or are working in the United States shall not actively participate in this Plan while they are U.S. citizens or residents or are working in the
	United States. Employees of the Company who are U.S. citizens or residents may be eligible to participate in the Univar Canada Ltd. Supplemental Benefits Plan for U.S. Citizens or Residents Working in Canada if they otherwise meet the requirements
	to participate in that plan. Only employees of the Company are eligible to participate in this Plan, and only pay earned and service for the Company while working in Canada other than as a U.S. citizen or resident shall be considered in determining
	benefits payable under this Plan. Service with and pay received from affiliates of the Company will not be considered under this Plan. Employees of a U.S. affiliate of the Company (&#145;&#145;U.S. Affiliate&#148;) who were transferred from the
	Company to the U.S. Affiliate may be eligible to participate in the Univar
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage267"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Canada Ltd. Supplemental Benefits Plan for Former Employees Working in the United States if they otherwise meet the requirements to participate in that plan. The supplemental benefits with
	respect to the Pension Plan that were earned by Paul Hough, Victor Langley and Patrick Tole while they were working for a U.S. Affiliate (e.g., make&middot; whole benefits, consideration of compensation earned in the United States) were not earned
	under this Plan, but instead were earned under the Univar Canada Ltd. Supplemental Benefits Plan for U.S. Citizens or Residents, and those benefits are being transferred to the Univar Canada Ltd. Supplemental Benefits Plan for Former Employees
	Working in the United States effective June&nbsp;1 , 2007.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	4.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Benefit Determination Date
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Benefits shall be determined under this Plan as of the same
	date that benefits are determined under the Pension Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<I>
	5.
</I>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<I>
</I>
<U>
	Benefit Amount
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The initial benefits under this Plan determined as of the
	benefit determination date shall equal the difference, if any, between (a)&nbsp;and (b)&nbsp;below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The monthly benefit for the life of the Participant, as calculated under the terms of the Pension Plan, without regard to the limitations described in Section&nbsp;147.1(2) of the Income Tax Act and Regulation 8504 and
	including for Quebec Participants, if applicable, the monthly benefit for the life of the Quebec Participant that would have been paid from the Pension Plan if the Quebec Participant had not previously transferred or received a lump sum refund of
	his benefits under the Pension Plan;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The monthly benefit for the life of the Participant, as calculated under the terms of the Pension Plan, which includes limitations described in Section&nbsp;147.1(2) of the Income Tax Act and Regulation 8504 and
	including for Quebec Participants, if applicable, the monthly benefit for the life of the Quebec Participant that would have been paid from the Pension Plan if the Quebec Participant had not previously transferred or received a lump sum refund of
	his benefits under the Pension Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A Participant shall not become vested in the benefits accrued under this Plan unless and until he or she becomes vested in the benefits provided by the Pension Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The initial benefits payable under this Plan shall be increased in the same manner and same percentage amount as any cost of living adjustment
	increases granted in respect of benefits payable from the Pension Plan.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage268"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	6.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Spouse&#146;s Death Benefits
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If a death benefit is payable under the Pension Plan to a
	spouse of a Participant, that spouse is eligible to receive benefits under this Plan. The benefit shall be calculated in the same manner as under Section&nbsp;5; that is, the death benefit under this Plan shall equal the difference, if any, between
	(a)&nbsp;and (b)&nbsp;below, plus any amounts described in (c)&nbsp;below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the spouse&#146;s death benefit calculated under the Pension Plan without regard to the limitations described in Section&nbsp;147.1(2) of the Income Tax Act and Regulations 8504 and including for Quebec Participants, if
	applicable, the monthly benefit for the life of the Quebec Participant that would have been paid from the Pension Plan if the Quebec Participant had not previously transferred or received a lump sum refund of his benefits under the Pension Plan; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the spouse&#146;s death benefit as calculated under the terms of the Pension Plan which includes limitations described in Section&nbsp;147.1(2) of the Income Tax Act and Regulation 8504 and including for Quebec
	Participants, if applicable, the monthly benefit for the life of the Quebec Participant that would have been paid from the Pension Plan if the Quebec Participant had not previously transferred or received a lump sum refund of his benefits under the
	Pension Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If the Participant was not survived by a Spouse, the Participant&#146;s surviving designated beneficiary or, if none, his
	estate, shall receive in an immediate lump sum payment the difference, if any, between (a)&nbsp;and (b)&nbsp;below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the beneficiary&#146;s death benefit calculated under Section&nbsp;8.3 of the Pension Plan without regard to the limitations described in Section&nbsp;147.1(2) of the Income Tax Act and Regulations 8504 and including
	for Quebec Participants, if applicable, the monthly benefit for the life of the Quebec Participant that would have been paid from the Pension Plan if the Quebec Participant had not previously transferred or received a lump sum refund of his benefits
	under the Pension Plan; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the beneficiary&#146;s death benefit calculated under Section&nbsp;8.3 of the Pension Plan which includes limitations described in Section&nbsp;147.1(2) of the Income Tax Act and Regulation 8504 and including for Quebec
	Participants, if applicable, the monthly benefit for the life of the Quebec Participant that would have been paid from the Pension Plan if the Quebec Participant had not previously transferred or received a lump sum refund of his benefits under the
	Pension Plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	7.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Creditable Pay and Service
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For purposes of calculating the benefits under Sections 5
	and 6 above, only a Participant&#146;s pay earned and service for the Company while an active Participant in this Plan working in Canada other than as a U.S. citizen or resident shall be considered. If a participant in the Univar Canada Ltd.
	Supplemental Benefits Plan for U.S. Citizens or Residents
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage269"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Working in Canada is also a Participant in this Plan (e.g., because he or she ceases to be a U.S. citizen or resident), benefits accrued under this Plan shall be calculated in such a way that
	they supplement (and not duplicate) the benefits provided under the Univar Canada Ltd. Supplemental Benefits Plan for U.S. Citizens or Residents Working in Canada so that the aggregate of the benefits accrued under both such plans plus the Pension
	Plan equals the aggregate benefit amount that would have been accrued under the Univar Canada Ltd. Supplemental Benefits Plan for U.S. Citizens or Residents Working in Canada and the Pension Plan had all of the Participant&#146;s pay and service for
	the Company in Canada been as a U.S. citizen or resident (with such benefit amounts being adjusted as if payments from all plans commenced on the same date).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	8.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Date and Form of Payment
</U>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Benefit payments under this Plan shall commence at the same
	time as the benefit under the Pension Plan commences. The benefit shall be paid in the same form as the benefit is paid under the Pension Plan and the actuarial equivalent assumptions used in determining the benefit in a given form shall be the same
	as are used to determine the benefit under the Pension Plan. If, pursuant to Section&nbsp;9 of Pension Plan, a Participant elects to have the Commuted Value (as defined in the Pension Plan) of the Participant&#146;s benefits under the Pension Plan
	transferred to another plan described in Section&nbsp;9.3 of the Pension Plan, then the Commuted Value of his benefit under this Plan shall be paid to the Participant in a lump sum at that time. The Company reserves the right to pay a lump sum
	amount in lieu of the monthly pension benefit set forth in Section&nbsp;5 if such monthly pension benefit is less than $100. This lump sum amount shall be the actuarial equivalent of the monthly pension benefit payment calculated on the advice of
	the Pension Plan Actuary.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	9.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Re-Employment After Payments Begin
</U>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If a Participant is re-employed after benefits
	commence, the Participant&#146;s benefits shall be suspended under this Plan. When the Participant retires for the final time, the benefit under this Plan shall be recalculated and adjusted in the same manner as the benefit is adjusted under the
	Pension Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	10.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Termination and Amendment of the Plan
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Plan shall continue in effect until
	terminated by resolution of the Company&#146;s Board of Directors. In the event of such termination, all amounts accrued and vested to date of termination, based on service and earnings to that date, shall be payable pursuant to the terms of this
	Plan as if the Plan had not been terminated. The Plan may be amended from time to time by resolution of the Board of Directors, or by action of any committee, officer or employee of the Company to whom the Board of Directors has delegated authority
	to amend the Plan, including, without limitation, the Pension Management Committee. No amendment or terminating resolution shall reduce any vested benefit accrued to the date of the resolution amending or terminating the Plan. In the event of a plan
	termination, the Board of Directors, at its option, may accelerate the payment of benefits and may pay benefits in a single, actuarially-equivalent, lump-sum amount.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage270"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event of the termination of the Plan where there are insufficient assets in the Trust
	Fund, the Board of Directors of the Company shall allocate amounts to Participants in the following order of priority unless the Board of Directors by resolution passed at the time of any such termination, shall decide that such allocation shall be
	made in accordance with a different formula which, in the opinion of the Board of Directors, constitutes a more equitable allocation bearing in mind all of the circumstances as they exist at the time of such termination, in which event such
	allocation shall be made in accordance with such different formula:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	first: benefits in payment at the date of termination;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	second: payment of benefits to those Participants eligible to retire under the Plan at the date of the termination;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	third: payment of benefits to all other Participants not included in (a)&nbsp;or (b)&nbsp;above.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	11.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Source of Benefit Payments
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	No Participant shall acquire any property interest in any
	assets of Univar Canada Ltd. or any affiliate thereof as a consequence of participating in this Plan. A Participant&#146;s rights are limited to receiving payments as set forth in this Plan. Except to the extent of assets in the Trust described
	below, this Plan is unfunded, and to the extent that any Participant acquires a right to receive benefits, such right shall be no greater than the right of any unsecured general creditor of Univar Canada Ltd. Any funds of Univar Canada Ltd.
	available to pay benefits under the Plan shall be subject to the claims of general creditors of Univar Canada Ltd. and may be used for any purpose by Univar Canada Ltd.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Trust Under Univar Canada Ltd. Supplemental Benefits Plan (&#147;Trust&#148;) has been created to provide for contributions by Univar
	Canada Ltd. to provide for contributions by Univar Canada Ltd to assist in funding Plan benefits. The assets of the Trust will not be subject to the claims of the creditors of Univar Canada Ltd. The Trust, and not Univar Canada Ltd., shall pay all
	expenses of the Trust and all taxes owed on income earned by the Trust on Trust assets. Univar Canada Ltd. shall pay all refundable taxes on contributions it makes to the Trust.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Contributions to the Trust of cash or other property (including, without limitation, a letter of credit) shall also be made by Univar Canada
	Ltd. in an amount sufficient to fund the actuarial present value (determined as of the time of contribution or letter of credit renewal) of benefits which are accrued by participants under the Plan. For purposes of determining the face amount of a
	letter of credit in which the Trustee is the beneficiary
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage271"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	needed to fund the Trust with respect to the actuarial present value of the accrued benefits under this Plan as of a given date, the actuarial assumptions used were the same actuarial assumptions
	used by Univar Canada Ltd. to determine the Accumulated Benefit Obligation (ABO) for Univar Canada Ltd. as required under FASB Statement Number 87 as of the Measurement Date immediately preceding or concurrent with such date, or equivalent
	assumptions. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in determining the amount of contributions (or the face amount of a letter of credit of which the Trustee is beneficiary) needed to fund the Trust, the amount shall be adjusted to take into account the
	fact that (i)&nbsp;the Company will withhold and remit to Canada Revenue Agency the refundable tax which is owed on its contributions to the Trust, (ii)&nbsp;the bank which issues a letter of credit with the Trustee named as beneficiary will
	withhold and remit to Canada Revenue Agency the refundable tax owed, if any, on any draw made by the Trustee on the letter of credit, and (iii)&nbsp;the Trust will receive tax refunds from Canada Revenue Agency of refundable taxes held in the
	Refundable Tax Account with respect to the benefits paid from the Trust. The actuary who determined the amount needed to fund the trust was the actuary engaged at the time by the Pension Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As explained in more detail in the Trust, if a letter of credit is deposited with the Trustee (with the Trustee named as beneficiary of the
	letter of credit), the face amount of the letter of credit may change annually upon renewal of the letter of credit due, for example, to changes in actuarial assumptions or .the payment of benefits during the year being completed. Upon renewal, such
	amount will be calculated using the actuarial assumptions and adjustments described above, except that the assumptions and adjustments shall be those as of the Measurement Date immediately preceding or concurrent with the date of renewal of the
	letter of credit. If the Company should change the standard under which it prepares accounting disclosures, an approach consistent with the above and based on the accounting disclosures most recently used should be taken for calculating the face
	value of the letter of credit.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Contributions shall be made to the Trust at least annually on or before July&nbsp;15 of each year. The face
	amount of a letter of credit which is used in funding the Trust shall be no less than the amount equal to the aggregate accrued liability of benefits owed to all Participants under the Plan projected to the twelfth (12th)&nbsp;month following the
	date as of which the accrued liability is calculated multiplied by one hundred and five percent (105%), less the amount of assets in the Trust and the Plan&#146;s rights to refundable tax.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	12.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Pension Management Committee
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Plan shall be administered by the Pension Management
	Committee, a committee appointed by the Board of Directors of the Company. The Pension Management Committee (hereinafter &#147;Committee&#148;) shall have full discretion to construe and interpret the terms and provisions of this Plan, which
	interpretation or construction shall be final and binding on all parties. The Committee shall administer such terms and provisions in a uniform and non-discriminating manner.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage272"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	13.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Claims Procedure
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following is the procedure for making claims under this Plan or
	appealing a decision made with respect to this Plan:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Filing Claim for Benefits
</U>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If a person does not receive the timely payment of the
	benefits which he or she believes are due under the Plan (hereinafter referred to as the &#147;Applicant&#148;), the Applicant may make a claim for benefits. All claims for benefits under the Plan shall be made in writing and shall be signed by the
	Applicant. Claims shall be submitted to the Committee. Each claim shall be approved or disapproved within 90 days following the receipt of the information necessary to process the claim. In the event the Committee denies a claim for benefits in
	whole or in part, the Committee shall notify the Applicant in writing of the denial of the claim, and notify the Applicant of the right to a review of the decision. Such notice shall also set forth the specific reason for such denial, the specific
	provisions of the Plan on which the denial is based, a description of any additional material or information necessary to perfect the claim with an explanation of why such material or information is necessary, and an explanation of the Plan&#146;s
	appeals procedure. If no action is taken by the Committee on an Applicant&#146;s claim within 90 days after receipt by the Committee, such claim shall be deemed to be denied for purposes of the following appeals procedure;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Appeals Procedure
</U>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any Applicant whose claim for benefits is denied in whole or in part
	may appeal to the Committee for a review of the decision. Such appeal must be made within three months after the Applicant has received actual or constructive notice of the denial. An appeal must be submitted in writing within such period and must:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(i) request a review by the Committee of the claim for benefits under the Plan;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(ii) set forth all of the grounds upon which the Applicant&#146;s request for review is based on and any facts in support thereof; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(iii) set forth any issues or comments which the Applicant deems pertinent to the appeal.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Committee shall act upon each appeal within 60 days after receipt unless special circumstances require an extension of the time for
	processing, in which case a decision shall be rendered by the Committee as soon as possible but not later than 120 days after
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage273"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	the appeal is received by the Committee. The Committee shall make full and fair review of each appeal and any written materials submitted by the Applicant in connection. The Committee may require
	the Applicant to submit such additional facts, documents or other evidence as the Committee in its discretion deems necessary or advisable in making its review. On the basis of its review, the Committee shall make an independent determination of the
	Applicant&#146;s eligibility for benefits under the Plan. The decision of the Committee shall be final and conclusive.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	14.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Alienation
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The right of any person to receive payments under this Plan shall not be
	subject to any type of assignment or pledge, nor shall such right be liable for or subject to the debts, contracts, liabilities or torts of such person.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	15.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Employee Benefit Statement
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Each employee covered by this Plan shall receive a
	statement each year which shows the total benefit payable under this Plan and the Pension Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	16.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Withholding
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Benefit payments shall be subject to applicable federal or provincial
	withholding for taxes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	17.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Successors
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event of any consolidation, merger, acquisition or reorganization,
	the obligations of Univar Canada Ltd. under this Plan shall continue and be binding on Univar Canada Ltd. and its successors or assigns.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	18.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	Governing Law
</U>
	.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Plan shall be construed in accordance with the laws of the Province
	of British Columbia.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This amended and restated plan is executed this 12
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day of June, 2007.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;/s/ Joel Kallner
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="3">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3">
	Its: Director
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_EXHIBIT_10>

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage274"></A>
<A NAME="D88742DEX1030_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_8"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.30
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	FIRST AMENDMENT TO THE
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	UNIVAR SUPPLEMENTAL BENEFITS PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(AS AMENDED AND RESTATED EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2004)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, Univar USA Inc. (&#147;Company&#148;) amended and restated its Supplemental Benefits Plan (&#147;Plan&#148;) effective July&nbsp;1,
	2004; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company has the authority to amend the Plan pursuant to Section&nbsp;10; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company would like to amend the Plan to rename the Plan the &#147;Univar Supplemental Retirement Benefits Plan&#148;, and to
	comply with Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (&#147;Code&#148;) which became effective January&nbsp;1, 2005, with respect to benefits that become accrued or vested under the Plan after 2004.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	NOW, THEREFORE, the Plan is hereby amended as follows, effective January&nbsp;1, 2005:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1. The name of the Plan is changed to the &#147;Univar Supplemental Retirement Benefits Plan&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2. Section&nbsp;1 of the Plan,
<U>
	Purpose
</U>
	, is amended in its entirety to read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Purpose
</U>
	. The purpose in establishing this Univar Supplemental Retirement Benefits Plan (&#147;Plan&#148;) is to provide retirement
	compensation to a select group of participants of the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan (hereinafter &#147;Retirement Plan&#148;) under the terms of that Retirement Plan without regard to limitations on benefits imposed under Internal Revenue Code
	(&#147;Code&#148;) Sections 415 and 401(a)(17) which apply to the Retirement Plan. In addition, this Plan provides benefits to certain Retirement Plan participants who transfer to a Non-U.S. Affiliate of Univar USA Inc. as listed on Appendix P of
	the Retirement Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3. Section&nbsp;2 of the Plan,
<U>
	Effective Date
</U>
	, is amended in its entirety to read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Effective Date
</U>
	. This Plan was established effective January&nbsp;11, 1983 and has been known, from time to time, as the Univar
	Corporation Supplemental Benefits Plan, the Van Waters&nbsp;&amp; Rogers Inc. Supplemental Benefits Plan, the VOPAK USA Inc. Supplemental Benefits Plan, the Univar USA Inc. Supplemental Benefits Plan, and the Univar Supplemental Benefits Plan. The
	Plan was last amended and restated effective July&nbsp;1, 2004, with the provisions of the amended and restated Plan applying only to those Participants who are employed by a Participating Employer on or after July&nbsp;1, 2004. Participants who
	terminated employment before July&nbsp;1, 2004 are subject to the provisions of the Plan as amended through June&nbsp;30, 2004, which provisions are appended to this Plan as Exhibit A. Effective January&nbsp;1, 2005, the Plan was amended to comply
	with Code Section&nbsp;409A with respect to benefits that become accrued or vested after December&nbsp;31, 2004.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage275"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4. Section&nbsp;4 of the Plan,
<U>
	Benefit Determination Date
</U>
	, is amended in its entirety to
	read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For Participants who terminate employment with the Participating Employers and their affiliates prior to January&nbsp;1,
	2005, benefits shall be determined under this Plan as of the same date that benefits are determined under the Retirement Plan. For Participants who terminate employment with the Participating Employers and their affiliates in 2005 and whose
	Retirement Plan benefit payments commence in 2005, benefits shall be determined under this Plan as of the same date that benefits are determined under the Retirement Plan. For Participants who terminate employment with the Participating Employers
	and their affiliates after December&nbsp;31, 2004 and whose Retirement Plan benefit payments commence after December&nbsp;31, 2005, benefits that are accrued and vested under this Plan as of December&nbsp;31, 2004 shall be determined under this Plan
	as of the same date that benefits are determined under the Retirement Plan, and benefits that accrue or become vested after December&nbsp;31, 2004 (&#147;Post-2004 Benefits&#148;) shall be determined as of the date the payment of such Post-2004
	Benefits is to commence (see Sections 7 and 8 below). For purposes of this Plan, the amount of benefits that are considered accrued as of December&nbsp;31, 2004 shall be determined in accordance with applicable IRS guidance, including, without
	limitation, Q&amp;A-17(a) of IRS Notice 2005-1 (to the extent it has not been superseded).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	5. Section&nbsp;5(c) of the Plan,
<U>
	Benefit
	Amount,
</U>
	is amended in its entirety to read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c) In addition to the difference between (a)&nbsp;and
	(b)&nbsp;above, this Plan shall provide &#147;make-whole payments&#148; described in Section&nbsp;6(a)(ii) below to certain participants who transfer employment to a Non-U.S. Affiliate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	6. The last sentence of Section&nbsp;5 of the Plan (beginning with the words &#147;Notwithstanding the provisions &#133;&#148; and ending with
	the words &#147;pursuant to Section&nbsp;5&#148;) is deleted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	7. The last two sentences of Section&nbsp;6(a)(ii) of the Plan,
<U>
	Make-Whole for Transferees to Non-U.S. Affiliates
</U>
	, are replaced with the following language:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The amount of this make-whole payment
	with respect to benefits accrued under this Plan prior to January&nbsp;1, 2005 shall be recalculated as of the beginning of each calendar year, and the amount of the Non-U.S. Benefit used in making this recalculation shall be redetermined using the
	applicable exchange rate in effect on the preceding December&nbsp;31. This annual recalculation shall not be made with respect to benefits that accrue under this Plan after December&nbsp;31, 2004. For Participants who terminate employment with the
	Participating Employers and their affiliates prior to January&nbsp;1, 2005, this make-whole payment shall be paid in the same form and at the same time that the Participant&#146;s benefit
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage276"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	under the Retirement Plan is paid. For Participants who terminate employment with the Participating Employers and their affiliates after December&nbsp;31, 2004, this make-whole payment shall be
	paid in the same form and at the same time that the Participant&#146;s Post-2004 Benefits under this Plan are paid.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	8. The first sentence
	of Section&nbsp;6.3(a)(iii),
<U>
	Currency Conversion Calculations Made After May&nbsp;1, 1999
</U>
	, is amended by changing any reference that is to 6(b) to a reference to 6(a).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	9. Section&nbsp;6(b) of the Plan,
<U>
	Transfers Occurring Prior to August&nbsp;15, 1997 Where Terminations Occur After August&nbsp;15,
	1997
</U>
	, is amended by changing any reference therein that is to Section&nbsp;6(b) to a reference to 6(a), and any reference that is to 6(c) to a reference to 6(b).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10. Section&nbsp;6(c) of the Plan,
<U>
	Transfers to or from U.S. Affiliates
</U>
	, is deleted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	11. Section&nbsp;7 of the Plan,
<U>
	Spouse&#146;s Death Benefit
</U>
	, is amended in its entirety to read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Spouse&#146;s Death Benefit
</U>
	. If a death benefit is payable under the Retirement Plan to a spouse of a Participant and as of the date of
	the Participant&#146;s death benefit payments had not yet commenced to the Participant under this Plan with respect to the Participant&#146;s entire benefit under this Plan (or the portion of the benefit accrued and vested as of December&nbsp;31,
	2004), that spouse is eligible to receive benefits under this Plan. The benefit shall be calculated in the same manner as under Section&nbsp;5; that is, the death benefit under this Plan shall equal the difference, if any, between (a)&nbsp;the
	spouse&#146;s death benefit calculated under the Retirement Plan without regard to the limitations described in Code Sections 415 and 401(a)(17), and (b)&nbsp;the spouse&#146;s death benefit as calculated under the terms of the Retirement Plan which
	includes limitations described in Code Sections 415 and 401(a)(17). However, in calculating such death benefit, there shall be a reduction for the actuarial equivalent of the Post-2004 Benefits paid (and to be paid) to the Participant and spouse. In
	the event a Participant had transferred to or from a Non-U.S. Affiliate of a Participating Employer, the spouse&#146;s benefit under this Plan shall be calculated in the same manner as set forth in Section&nbsp;6 above, with the applicable
	reductions made because the benefits is a spousal benefit. If the Participant dies after benefit payments have commenced under this Plan, the Participant&#146;s spouse (or former spouse, as applicable) shall receive benefits under this Plan with
	respect to the portion of the Plan benefits that had commenced payment only if and to the extent such benefit is being paid in the form of a joint and survivor annuity with such spouse (or former spouse) named as joint annuitant, or a period certain
	and life annuity with the spouse (or former spouse) named as a beneficiary. Death benefits payable with respect to Plan benefits accrued and vested as of December&nbsp;31, 2004 shall be paid in the form and at the time that death benefits under the
	Retirement Plan are paid. Death benefits payable with respect to Post-2004 Benefits (i.e., which had not commenced as of the date of the Participant&#146;s death) shall be paid as a single life annuity to the Participant&#146;s surviving spouse
	commencing as soon as practicable after the Participant&#146;s death.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage277"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	12. Section&nbsp;8 of the Plan,
<U>
	Date and Form of Payment
</U>
	, is amended in its entirety to
	read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Date and Form of Payment
</U>
	. With respect to benefits that were accrued and vested as of December&nbsp;31, 2004,
	benefit payments under this Plan shall commence at the same time as the benefit payments under the Retirement Plan commence. Such benefit shall be paid in the same form as the benefit is paid under the Retirement Plan and the actuarial equivalent
	assumptions used in determining the benefit in a given form shall be the same as are used to determine the benefit under the Retirement Plan. With respect to Post-2004 Benefits, Plan benefit payments shall commence as soon as practicable after the
	later of the date the Participant attains age 55 or separates from service with a Participating Employer and all affiliates thereof. Shortly before or after such date, the Participant will be permitted to choose the form of annuity payment in which
	such Post-2004 Benefits will be paid from the actuarially equivalent annuity forms of distribution available under the Retirement Plan at such time. For purposes of this Plan, the phrase &#147;separation from service&#148; shall be construed in a
	manner consistent with the meaning of the term under Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(A)(i). Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Participant shall have the option to make a one-time, irrevocable election to defer commencement of payment of his or her
	Post-2004 Benefits to a date that is at least five (5)&nbsp;years after the later of the date the Participant attains age 55 or separates from service with a Participating Employer and all affiliates thereof (&#147;Election to Delay Payment&#148;).
	In order to be valid and effective, the Election to Delay Payment must be received by the Committee (as defined in Section&nbsp;12) prior to the time the Participant attains age 54. A Participant can change or withdraw a previously submitted
	Election to Delay Payment by contacting the Committee any time prior to attaining age 54 and asking for an existing Election to Delay Payment form to be cancelled and, if the Participant wants to make a new election, by submitting the new Election
	to Delay Payment form to the Committee prior to attaining age 54. Once a Participant attains age 54, the Participant cannot change an Election to Delay Payment form held by the Committee that is valid and in effect, nor can the Participant submit an
	Election to Delay Payment form if a valid and effective election is not currently held by the Committee. In the Election to Delay Payment, the Participant must request that his or her benefit payment commencement date for Post-2004 Benefits be the
	later of (i)&nbsp;a particular date that the Participant elects that is on or after the date the Participant will attain age 60, and (ii)&nbsp;a particular number of years after separation from service (the Participant elects the number of years,
	which must be at least five (5)&nbsp;years). Payment under a valid Election to Delay Payment shall commence as soon as practicable after the applicable date, but in no event sooner than five (5)&nbsp;years after payment would have commenced absent
	such Election to Delay Payment. The requirements for the Election to Delay Payment shall be construed in a manner consistent with the requirements set forth in Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(4)(C). In the event the Participant dies before benefit
	payments have commenced with respect to benefits accrued and vested on December&nbsp;31, 2004 or Post-2004 Benefits, the form and timing of payment of any death benefits to a surviving spouse of the Participant with respect to such benefit shall be
	governed by Section&nbsp;7 above, not this Section.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage278"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	13. The last sentence of Section&nbsp;10 of the Plan,
<U>
	Termination and Amendment of the
	Plan
</U>
	, (which begins with the words &#147;In the event &#133;&#148; and ends with the words &#147;&#133; lump sum amount&#148;), is amended in its entirety to read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event of such termination, no additional benefits shall accrue under the Plan, but benefits that were accrued on such termination date
	shall be paid at the time and in the manner set forth in Sections 7 and 8 above (i.e., the timing of benefit payment shall not be accelerated as a result of the termination).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	14. The fourth and fifth sentences of the second paragraph of Section&nbsp;11 of the Plan,
<U>
	Source of Benefit Payments
</U>
	, are amended in
	their entirety to read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Similarly, the Trust sponsored by Univar USA Delaware, Inc. will cover Participants whose last
	employment with the Univar Companies was with Univar USA Delaware, Inc. or Univar USA Inc. on or after July&nbsp;1, 2004, but not those who were last employed by Univar Inc. or Univar Delaware Inc. (or Univar USA Inc. prior to July&nbsp;1, 2004).
	The Trust sponsored by Univar USA Inc. will cover Participants who terminated employment with the Univar Companies prior to July&nbsp;1, 2004.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	15. The seventh (7
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	)&nbsp;sentence of the second paragraph of Section&nbsp;11 of the
	Plan,
<U>
	Source of Benefit Payments
</U>
	, which begins with the words &#147;Notwithstanding the foregoing, Participants or beneficiaries who terminated employment&#133;&#148; and ends with the words &#147;&#133; entity other than Univar USA
	Inc.&#148;, is deleted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	16. The second sentence of the fifth paragraph of Section&nbsp;11 of the Plan,
<U>
	Source of Benefit Payments
</U>
	,
	is amended by removing the words &#147;on or before July&nbsp;15 of each year&#148; from the end of that sentence.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	17. Appendix A of the
	Plan,
<U>
	Non-U.S. Affiliates
</U>
	, is amended by changing the reference to &#147;Van Waters&nbsp;&amp; Rogers Ltd.&#148; to &#147;Univar Canada Ltd.&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	18. Appendix B of the Plan is deleted from the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This First Amendment is executed this 17
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day of May, 2005.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage279"></A>
<A NAME="D88742DEX1031_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_9"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.31
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	SECOND AMENDMENT TO THE
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	UNIVAR SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT BENEFITS PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(AS AMENDED AND RESTATED EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2004)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company has the authority to amend the Supplemental Retirement Benefits Plan (&#147;Plan&#148;) pursuant to Section&nbsp;10; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, in April 2006 amendments were made to the employment agreements for Gary Pruitt, John Sammons, Patrick Tole and David Mahon to
	revise the methods for calculating their benefits under the Plan; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company would like to amend the Plan to reflect the
	revised terms for calculating benefits for the foregoing executives, and to add a provision to delay benefit payouts for six (6)&nbsp;months for certain specified employees who incur a separation from service to the extent such delay is requires by
	Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	NOW, THEREFORE, the Plan is hereby amended as follows, effective as of the respective
	effective dates set forth below:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1. Effective September&nbsp;1, 2006, the name of the Plan is changed to the &#147;Univar USA Inc.
	Supplemental Retirement Plan&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2. Effective May&nbsp;1, 2006, the following paragraph is added to the end of Section&nbsp;5 of the
	Plan,
<U>
	Benefit Amount
</U>
	:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding the above in this Section&nbsp;5 of the Plan, Univar USA, Inc. may amend the
	Plan at any time to provide different formulas and terms for determining the amount of benefit a Participant accrues under this Plan, and such different formulas and terms may result in more or less benefits being accrued by such Participant than
	what would be accrued under the terms above in this Section&nbsp;5 above. Any change in the formulas and terms that result (or may result) in a reduction in benefits already accrued by a Participant under the Plan at the time the amendment is
	adopted must be consented to by the Participant. The different formulas and terms that apply to a Participant shall be set forth in Appendix B hereto.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3. Effective January&nbsp;1, 2005, the following paragraph is added to the end of Section&nbsp;8 of the Plan,
<U>
	Date and Form of Payment
</U>
	,
	to read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding the foregoing, if at the time a Participant separates from service the Participant is
	considered a &#147;specified employee&#148; subject to the required six month delay in benefit payments under Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i), then any annuity payments for Post-2004 Benefits that would otherwise be paid under this Section&nbsp;8
	within the first six (6)&nbsp;months after such Participant&#146;s separation from service shall be paid in a single lump sum on (or within 15 days after) the six month anniversary of the Participant&#146;s separation from service. After such six
	month anniversary, the Participant&#146;s
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage280"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	annuity payments shall be made on the normal schedule as elected by the Participant. Nothing in this paragraph shall change the form or timing of benefit payout if a Participant who is a
	specified employee dies after separation from service and before the six month anniversary of such separation from service.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4. Effective
	May&nbsp;1, 2006, the following is added as Appendix B to the Plan:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	APPENDIX B
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	DIFFERENT BENEFIT FORMULAS AND TERMS FOR CERTAIN PARTICIPANTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following are different formulas and terms that apply to determine the benefits under this Plan for the Participants set forth below. Some
	of the formulas and terms only apply in certain circumstances, such as after certain types of terminations of employment. None of the following special formulas and terms shall apply to the calculation of the following Participants&#146; benefits
	that are actually accrued and paid from the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan, although they will be used in calculating for purposes of this Plan the amount of benefits that would be accrued and payable to such Participants&#146; under the Univar USA
	Inc. Retirement Plan if Code Sections 415 and 401(a)(17) did not apply to such plan. Benefits accrued by a Participant below under this Plan will be calculated by first determining the amount he would have accrued under the Univar USA Inc.
	Retirement Plan if the following formulas and terms applied under such plan and the annual compensation limit under Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;401(a)(17) and annual benefit limit under Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;415(b) did not apply.
	Second, the Participant&#146;s actual accrued benefit under the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan will be subtracted from the amount calculated pursuant to the preceding sentence, and the difference shall be the amount payable from this Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following formulas and terms for Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt, Mr.&nbsp;Sammons, Mr.&nbsp;Tole and Mr.&nbsp;Mahon apply only to the extent required by
	the respective employment agreements each of them has with Univar N.V. or Univar Inc. Thus, for example, in the event the required formulas or terms for calculating benefits under this Plan are changed through an amendment to an employment
	agreement, the formulas and terms under this Appendix B for the executive whose employment agreement was amended shall be considered amended in a like manner.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Gary E. Pruitt
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For all purposes relating
	to Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s benefits under this Plan, he shall be treated as if he is two (2)&nbsp;years older than his actual age, regardless of the reason for his termination of employment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event that Section&nbsp;11.1(d) of the employment agreement between Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt and Univar N.V. dated July&nbsp;1, 2002, as amended
	effective April&nbsp;2, 2006 (hereinafter &#147;Employment Agreement) applies due to the type of termination of Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s employment, the formulas and terms set forth in the following five subparagraphs shall apply in calculating his
	benefit under this Plan:
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage281"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1) Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt shall be treated as if he is five (5)&nbsp;years older than his actual age,
	and he shall be treated as if he had five (5)&nbsp;additional years of credited service for purposes of calculating his accrued benefit under the Plan, provided, however, that his assumed age will never be higher than 60 years of age and the
	credited years of service will never be more than it should have been if Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt had been employed with Univar Inc. until May&nbsp;30, 2010.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2) The &#147;Earnings&#148; used to calculate Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s retirement benefits under this Plan shall be as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#147;Earnings&#148; means the Employee&#146;s base salary (including employee elective deferrals of base salary that are not includible in
	gross income under Code Sections 125 or 401(k) or deferrals to a nonqualified retirement plan). Earnings shall not include bonuses.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<CENTER>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:21%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</CENTER>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3) The Accrued
	Benefit formula used to calculate Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s retirement benefits under this Plan shall be the formula stated in section 4.01 of the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan except that the second subsection (b)(i) (being the subsection effective
	for Participants who terminate employment with the Employer on or after August&nbsp;1, 1999) shall be replaced with the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b)(i)
	3.4% of the Final Average Monthly Earnings minus .5% of the integration level multiplied by;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<CENTER>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:21%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</CENTER>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4) In the
	event of Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s termination of employment under section 10(d) of his Employment Agreement, the definition of
<U>
	Final Average Monthly Earnings
</U>
	at Section&nbsp;1.13 of the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan used in the calculation of
	Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s retirement benefits under this Plan shall be replaced with the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.13
<U>
	Final Average Monthly
	Earnings
</U>
	means one twelfth of the Participant&#146;s annual rate of salary at time of termination of employment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<CENTER>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:21%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</CENTER>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5) When
	determining Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s retirement benefit under this Plan, in no event will the Final Average Earnings include Earnings received before July&nbsp;1, 2002.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	John P. Sammons
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In calculating
	Mr.&nbsp;Sammons&#146; benefits under this Plan, he shall be treated as if he had thirty-six (36)&nbsp;additional months of credited service for purposes of calculating his accrued benefit under the Plan, regardless of the reason for his termination
	of employment with Univar Inc.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event Univar Inc. terminates Mr.&nbsp;Sammons&#146; employment other
	than for Cause or Total Disability (as defined in his employment agreement
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage282"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	with Univar Inc. dated February&nbsp;19, 2003, as amended effective April&nbsp;11, 2006, hereinafter &#147;Employment Agreement&#148;) or if Mr.&nbsp;Sammons terminates his employment for Good
	Reason in the absence of Cause (as such terms are defined in the Employment Agreement), and if also such termination is within twenty-four (24)&nbsp;months immediately following of a Change in Control (as defined in the Employment Agreement), in
	lieu of assuming Mr.&nbsp;Sammons has the thirty-six (36)&nbsp;additional months of credited service as described in the immediately preceding paragraph, Mr.&nbsp;Sammons&#146; retirement benefit under this Plan shall be determined using
	(a)&nbsp;the greater of Mr.&nbsp;Sammons&#146; actual age or age 62 and (b)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Sammons&#146; years of credited service shall be determined using the greater of his actual years of credited service or years of credited service based on
	assumed employment with Univar Inc. to age 65.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Patrick D. Tole
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event Univar Inc. terminates Mr.&nbsp;Tole&#146;s employment other than for Cause or Total Disability (as defined in his employment
	agreement with Univar Inc. dated February&nbsp;19, 2003, as amended effective April&nbsp;11, 2006, hereinafter &#147;Employment Agreement&#148;) or if Mr.&nbsp;Tole terminates his employment for Good Reason in the absence of Cause (as such terms are
	defined in the Employment Agreement), and if also such termination is within twenty-four (24)&nbsp;months immediately following of a Change in Control (as defined in the Employment Agreement), Mr.&nbsp;Tole&#146;s retirement benefit under this Plan
	shall be determined using (a)&nbsp;the greater of Mr.&nbsp;Tole&#146;s actual age or age 55 and (b)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Tole&#146;s years of credited service shall be determined using the greater of his actual years of credited service or years of
	credited service based on assumed employment with Univar Inc. to age 55.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	David Mahon
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In calculating Mr.&nbsp;Mahon&#146;s benefits under this Plan, all of Mr.&nbsp;Mahon&#146;s periods of employment with and compensation
	received from Vopak Industrial Services (aka Vopak Logistics) and Strategic Chemical Management Group, LLC from August&nbsp;1, 1999 to June&nbsp;30, 2002 shall be considered as periods of service with and compensation received from Univar USA Inc.
	or Univar Inc.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event Univar Inc. terminates Mr.&nbsp;Mahon&#146;s employment other than for Cause
	or Total Disability (as defined in his employment agreement with Univar Inc. dated October&nbsp;29, 2004, as amended effective April&nbsp;11, 2006, hereinafter &#147;Employment Agreement&#148;) or if Mr.&nbsp;Mahon terminates Mr.&nbsp;Mahon&#146;s
	employment for Good Reason in the absence of Cause (as such terms are defined in the Employment Agreement), and if also such termination is within twenty-four (24)&nbsp;months immediately following of a Change in Control (as defined in the
	Employment Agreement), in addition to the service and compensation credit described in the immediately preceding paragraph, Mr.&nbsp;Mahon&#146;s retirement benefit under this Plan shall be determined using (a)&nbsp;the greater of
	Mr.&nbsp;Mahon&#146;s actual age or age 55 and (b)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Mahon&#146;s years of credited service shall be determined using the greater of his actual years of service or years of credited service based on assumed employment with Univar Inc. to
	age 55.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage283"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Second Amendment is executed this 24
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day of August, 2006.
</P>
