<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_10"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.32
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	THIRD AMENDMENT TO THE
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	UNIVAR USA INC. SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(AS AMENDED AND RESTATED EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2004)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, Univar USA Inc. (&#147;Company&#148;) has the authority to amend the Univar USA Inc. Supplemental Retirement Plan (&#147;Plan&#148;)
	pursuant to Section&nbsp;10; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, Univar Canada Ltd. (&#147;Univar Canada&#148;) sponsors the Univar Canada Ltd. Supplemental
	Benefits Plan for Former Employees Working in the United States (&#147;Canadian Plan&#148;), an unfunded nonqualified plan providing benefits to former employees of Univar Canada Ltd. who were transferred from Univar Canada to the Company, Univar,
	Inc. or certain other U.S. affiliates; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, benefits that are accrued and vested under the Canadian Plan are paid by Univar
	Canada Ltd. from its general assets, and are not paid through a trust or other fund; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company and Univar, Inc. have
	promised to guarantee the payment of vested and accrued benefits to participants in the Canadian Plan to the extent Univar Canada Ltd. cannot and does not pay such benefits; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company would like to amend the Plan to provide for the guarantee and to have the guarantee covered by the rabbi trusts for the
	Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	NOW, THEREFORE, the Plan is hereby amended as follows, effective June&nbsp;1, 2007:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1. The following paragraph is inserted before the last paragraph of Section&nbsp;3 of the Plan,
<U>
	Participation
</U>
	:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding the foregoing, management and highly compensated employees of a Participating Employer (as defined below) who
	are accruing additional benefits in the Univar Canada Ltd. Supplemental Benefits Plan for Former Employees Working in the United States (&#147;Canadian Plan&#148;) while working in the United States for such Participating Employer shall be
	participants in this Plan entitled to the benefits as described in Appendix C hereto. In addition, Paul Hough and Victor Langley shall be participants in this Plan for the purpose of receiving those benefits described in Appendix C plus any benefits
	they previously accrued under this Plan. Participants in the Canadian Plan who are management and highly compensated employees of a Participating Employer but are not participants in this Plan pursuant to the terms of the first two paragraphs of
	this Section&nbsp;3 shall be participants in this Plan only for the purpose of receiving from this Plan those benefits described in Appendix C, and shall not earn or receive benefits described in the remaining portions of this Plan document.
	Participants described in this paragraph shall collectively be referred to herein as &#147;Canadian Plan Participants&#148;. For Canadian Plan Participants who are also participants in this Plan pursuant to the terms of the first two paragraphs of
	this Section&nbsp;3, the benefits described in Appendix C are in addition to any benefits they earn under the remaining portions of this Plan document.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage285"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2. The following paragraph is added to the end of Section&nbsp;5 of the Plan,
<U>
	Benefit
	Amount
</U>
	:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding the above in this Section&nbsp;5 of the Plan, Canadian Plan Participants are entitled to the
	benefits as described in Appendix C hereto. In addition, Paul Hough and Victor Langley receive any benefits they previously accrued under this Plan. Canadian Plan Participants who are not participants in this Plan pursuant to the terms of the first
	two paragraphs of this Section&nbsp;3 shall not earn or receive benefits described in any portions of this Plan document other than Appendix C.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3. The following is added to the end of the Plan as Appendix C, BENEFITS FOR CANADIAN PLAN PARTICIPANTS:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	APPENDIX C
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	BENEFITS
	FOR CANADIAN PLAN PARTICIPANTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To the extent that, due to its insolvency or other financial or legal impediment, Univar Canada Ltd.
	cannot and does not pay a Canadian Plan Participant a benefit payment that is due and owing to the Canadian Plan Participant under the Canadian Plan, such payment shall be made under this Plan on or as soon as practicable after such payment would
	have been made by Univar Canada Ltd. under the Canadian Plan. Payment shall be made in Canadian dollars or, at the election of the Administrative Committee, in U.S. dollars. If payment is made in U.S. dollars, the amount of such payment shall be
	determined by converting the Canadian payment amount to U.S. dollars using the Canadian/U.S. dollar exchange rate offered at the principal bank used by the employer paying the benefit on the business day immediately preceding the date the payment is
	made. The Canadian Plan shall comply with Code Section&nbsp;409A with respect to the payment of benefits that are subject to 409A (e.g., not grandfathered out of 409A). Any benefit payments required to be made under this Appendix C shall be made by
	the employer that last employed the participant prior to his or her retirement from the Company and its affiliates, or from the appropriate rabbi trust. For example, should Patrick Tole retire from Univar, Inc., any payments required to be made to
	Patrick Tole will be made by Univar, Inc. or the rabbi trust sponsored by Univar Delaware, Inc. Notwithstanding the foregoing, any payments required to be made to Paul Hough or Victor Langley will be made by Univar USA Inc. or the rabbi trust
	sponsored by Univar USA Inc. As provided in the rabbi trust agreement, no benefits are paid by a rabbi trust while the sponsor of such trust is insolvent. Assets or a letter of credit sufficient to cover potential guarantee payments under this
	Appendix C shall be placed at least annually in the applicable rabbi trust.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Third Amendment is executed this 11
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day of June, 2007.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="40%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">

</TD>

	UNIVAR USA INC.
</TD>

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage286"></A>
<A NAME="D88742DEX1034_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_11"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.34
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	FIFTH AMENDMENT TO THE
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	UNIVAR USA INC. SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(As Amended and Restated Effective July&nbsp;1, 2004)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, Univar USA Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) sponsors and maintains the Univar USA Inc. Supplemental Retirement Plan (the
	&#147;Plan&#148;); and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company has the authority to amend the Plan pursuant to Section&nbsp;10 of the Plan; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company desires to amend the Plan to provide that Gary Pruitt shall receive a benefit payable in the form of a 100% joint and
	survivor annuity in a monthly amount equal to the difference between $70,879 and the amount of his vested accrued benefit that would be payable to him monthly under the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan (the latter amount calculated and adjusted per
	the terms of the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan as if such benefit were paid in the form of a 100% joint and survivor annuity commencing on the same date his benefit payments under this Plan commence) pursuant to the Univar N. V. written
	resolutions dated October 2007.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	NOW, THEREFORE, the Plan is hereby amended as follows, effective December &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, 2007:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1. Section&nbsp;5 of the Plan,
<U>
	Benefit Amount
</U>
	, is hereby amended by adding the following paragraph to the end thereof to read as
	follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#147;Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, Mr.&nbsp;Gary Pruitt and his surviving
	spouse, if any, are entitled to the benefit as described in Appendix E hereto, and the benefit described in Appendix E shall be the only benefit Mr.&nbsp;Gary Pruitt and his surviving spouse, if any, will receive from this Plan.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2. Section&nbsp;7 of the Plan,
<U>
	Spouse&#146;s Death Benefit
</U>
	, is hereby amended by adding the following paragraph to the end thereof to
	read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#147;Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, Mr.&nbsp;Gary Pruitt&#146;s
	surviving spouse, if any, shall be entitled to a death benefit payable in the form of a single life annuity payable for her life in a monthly amount equal to the monthly amount payable to Mr.&nbsp;Gary Pruitt as described in Appendix E hereto. Such
	benefit shall be the only death benefit payable to Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s surviving spouse from this Plan upon Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s death.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3. Section&nbsp;8 of the Plan,
<U>
	Date and Form of Payment
</U>
	, is hereby amended by adding the following paragraph to the end thereof to read
	as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#147;Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, the entire benefit payable to
	Mr.&nbsp;Gary Pruitt pursuant to Appendix E shall be treated as if it were Post-2004 Benefits and paid in the form of a 100% joint and survivor annuity commencing as soon as practicable after he separates from service with a Participating Employer
	and all affiliates thereof.&#148;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage287"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4. Appendix B of the Plan, DIFFERENT BENEFIT FORMULAS AND TERMS FOR CERTAIN PARTICIPANTS, is
	hereby amended in its entirety to read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	&#147;APPENDIX B
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	DIFFERENT BENEFIT FORMULAS AND TERMS FOR CERTAIN PARTICIPANTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following are different formulas and terms that apply to determine the benefits under this Plan for the Participants set forth below. Some
	of the formulas and terms only apply in certain circumstances, such as after certain types of terminations of employment. None of the following special formulas and terms shall apply to the calculation of the following Participants&#146; benefits
	that are actually accrued and paid from the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan, although they will be used in calculating for purposes of this Plan the amount of benefits that would be accrued and payable to such Participants&#146; under the Univar USA
	Inc. Retirement Plan if Code Sections 415 and 401(a)(17) did not apply to such plan. Benefits accrued by a Participant below under this Plan will be calculated by first determining the amount he would have accrued under the Univar USA Inc.
	Retirement Plan if the following formulas and terms applied under such plan and the annual compensation limit under Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;401(a)(17) and annual benefit limit under Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;415(b) did not apply.
	Second, the Participant&#146;s actual accrued benefit under the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan will be subtracted from the amount calculated pursuant to the preceding sentence, and the difference shall be the amount payable from this Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following formulas and terms for Mr.&nbsp;Sammons, Mr.&nbsp;Tole and Mr.&nbsp;Mahon apply only to the extent required by the respective
	employment agreements each of them has with Univar N.V. or Univar Inc. Thus, for example, in the event the required formulas or terms for calculating benefits under this Plan are changed through an amendment to an employment agreement, the formulas
	and terms under this Appendix B for the executive whose employment agreement was amended shall be considered amended in a like manner.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	John P. Sammons
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In calculating Mr.&nbsp;Sammons&#146; benefits under this Plan, he shall be treated as if he had thirty-six (36)&nbsp;additional
	months of credited service for purposes of calculating his accrued benefit under the Plan, regardless of the reason for his termination of employment with Univar Inc.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event Univar Inc. terminates Mr.&nbsp;Sammons&#146; employment other than for Cause or Total Disability
	(as defined in his employment agreement with Univar Inc. dated February&nbsp;19, 2003, as amended effective April&nbsp;11, 2006, hereinafter &#147;Employment Agreement&#148;) or if Mr.&nbsp;Sammons terminates his employment for Good Reason in the
	absence of Cause (as such terms are defined in the Employment Agreement), and if also such termination is within twenty-four (24)&nbsp;months immediately following of a Change in Control (as
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage288"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	defined in the Employment Agreement), in lieu of assuming Mr.&nbsp;Sammons has the thirty-six (36)&nbsp;additional months of credited service as described in the immediately preceding paragraph,
	Mr.&nbsp;Sammons&#146; retirement benefit under this Plan shall be determined using (a)&nbsp;the greater of Mr.&nbsp;Sammons&#146; actual age or age 62 and (b)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Sammons&#146; years of credited service shall be determined using the
	greater of his actual years of credited service or years of credited service based on assumed employment with Univar Inc. to age 65.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Patrick D. Tole
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event Univar Inc. terminates Mr.&nbsp;Tole&#146;s employment other than for Cause or Total Disability (as defined in his
	employment agreement with Univar Inc. dated February&nbsp;19, 2003, as amended effective April&nbsp;11, 2006, hereinafter &#147;Employment Agreement&#148;) or if Mr.&nbsp;Tole terminates his employment for Good Reason in the absence of Cause (as
	such terms are defined in the Employment Agreement), and if also such termination is within twenty-four (24)&nbsp;months immediately following of a Change in Control (as defined in the Employment Agreement), Mr.&nbsp;Tole&#146;s retirement benefit
	under this Plan shall be determined using (a)&nbsp;the greater of Mr.&nbsp;Tole&#146;s actual age or age 55 and (b)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Tole&#146;s years of credited service shall be determined using the greater of his actual years of credited service or
	years of credited service based on assumed employment with Univar Inc. to age 55.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	David Mahon
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In calculating Mr.&nbsp;Mahon&#146;s benefits under this Plan, all of Mr.&nbsp;Mahon&#146;s periods of employment with and compensation
	received from Vopak Industrial Services (aka Vopak Logistics) and Strategic Chemical Management Group, LLC from August&nbsp;1, 1999 to June&nbsp;30, 2002 shall be considered as periods of service with and compensation received from Univar USA Inc.
	or Univar Inc.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event Univar Inc. terminates Mr.&nbsp;Mahon&#146;s employment other than for Cause
	or Total Disability (as defined in his employment agreement with Univar Inc. dated October&nbsp;29, 2004, as amended effective April&nbsp;11, 2006, hereinafter &#147;Employment Agreement&#148;) or if Mr.&nbsp;Mahon terminates Mr.&nbsp;Mahon&#146;s
	employment for Good Reason in the absence of Cause (as such terms are defined in the Employment Agreement), and if also such termination is within twenty-four (24)&nbsp;months immediately following of a Change in Control (as defined in the
	Employment Agreement), in addition to the service and compensation credit described in the immediately preceding paragraph, Mr.&nbsp;Mahon&#146;s retirement benefit under this Plan shall be determined using (a)&nbsp;the greater of
	Mr.&nbsp;Mahon&#146;s actual age or age 55 and (b)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Mahon&#146;s years of credited service shall be determined using the greater of his actual years of service or years of credited service based on assumed employment with Univar Inc. to
	age 55.&#148;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage289"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	5. The Plan is hereby amended by adding a new Appendix E to read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	&#147;APPENDIX E
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	BENEFIT FOR GARY E. PRUITT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, Mr.&nbsp;Gary Pruitt shall be entitled to a monthly benefit from this Plan in
	an amount equal to the difference between $70,879 and the amount of his vested accrued benefit that would be payable to him monthly under the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan (the latter amount calculated and adjusted per the terms of the Univar USA
	Inc. Retirement Plan as if such benefit were paid in the form of a 100% joint and survivor annuity commencing on the same date his benefit payments under this Plan commence), such difference to be payable in the form of a 100% joint and survivor
	annuity with the woman who is his spouse at the time his monthly benefit payments commence to him under this Plan as joint annuitant. In calculating Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s benefit amount to be paid from this Plan, the $70,879 figure referenced in
	the immediately preceding sentence shall neither be increased nor decreased to take into account Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s age when benefit payments from this Plan begin (e.g., the $70,879 figure shall not be reduced if his benefit payments under this
	Plan commence before he has attained age 65, nor increased if they commence after he has attained age 65). In addition, the $70,879 figure shall not be decreased for the fact that the benefit will be paid in the form of a 100% joint and survivor
	annuity (e.g., the $70,879 figure will not be multiplied by 0.87, the reduction factor that is applied under the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan to convert a single life annuity to a 100% joint and survivor annuity). Similarly, in the event
	Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt is not married when his benefit payments commence under this Plan, the $70,879 figure will not be increased to reflect the fact that the benefit will be paid over Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s life in the form of a single life annuity
	instead of in the form of a joint and survivor annuity. Benefit payments to Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt under this Plan will commence as soon as practicable after he separates from service with a Participating Employer and all affiliates thereof, and will be
	unaffected by the actual timing and form of payment of his benefits from the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan. Upon Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s death, if Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt is survived by the woman who was his spouse on the date when benefit payments
	commenced to him under this Plan, his surviving spouse shall continue to receive from this Plan for the rest of her life the same dollar amount per month that was being paid to Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt under this Plan prior to his death. If Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt
	dies before benefit payments have commenced to him under this Plan and he is survived by a spouse, such spouse shall receive a monthly benefit from this Plan in an amount equal to the difference between $70,879 and the amount of his vested accrued
	benefit that would have been payable to him monthly under the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan (the latter amount calculated and adjusted per the terms of the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan as if such benefit were paid in the form of a 100% joint
	and survivor annuity commencing on the day immediately preceding the date of his death). For purposes of calculating the benefit payable to Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt and his surviving spouse, if any, under this Plan, the reduction factor set forth in the
	Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan that converts the normal accrued benefit payable in the form of a single life annuity to benefit payable in the form of a 100% joint and survivor annuity by multiplying the amount of the single life annuity by 0.87
	shall apply for purposes of calculating the amount of Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s accrued benefit that would be paid monthly from the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan in the form of a 100% joint and survivor annuity. In addition, for purposes of
	calculating the benefit payable to Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt and
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage290"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	his surviving spouse, if any, under this Plan, if Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s benefit payments under this Plan payments commence before or after the first of the month after he attains age 65 (or, in
	the case of the pre-retirement death benefit, Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt dies other than in the month in which he would attain age 65), then the early retirement reductions (or increases for retirement after age 65, as the case may be) set forth in the Univar
	USA Inc. Retirement Plan that convert his normal accrued benefit commencing at age 65 to a different benefit amount reflecting benefit commencement before or after his 65
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	birthday shall apply
	for purposes of calculating the amount of Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt&#146;s accrued benefit under the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan that is subtracted from the $70,879 monthly figure described above. In no event will any survivor annuity be payable to any
	person other than the woman who is his spouse on the earlier of the date of his death or the date benefit payments commence to him under this Plan. All benefit payments shall be subject to (and reduced by) applicable tax withholdings.
	Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, the benefit described in this Appendix E shall be the only benefit payable from this Plan to Mr.&nbsp;Pruitt and his surviving spouse, if any.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Fifth Amendment is executed this 6
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day of December, 2007.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;

</TD>
</TR>

</TD>

	Its President
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	I, Gary E. Pruitt, hereby consent to the foregoing changes being made to the Plan with respect to my Plan benefit.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV ALIGN="RIGHT">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="40%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="100%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	/s/ Gary E. Pruitt
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Gary E. Pruitt
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">
</TD>
</TR>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Date Signed: December&nbsp;4, 2007
</TD>

<A NAME="eolPage291"></A>
<A NAME="D88742DEX1035_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_12"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.35
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	UNIVAR USA INC. SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(As Amended and Restated Effective July&nbsp;1, 2004)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<U>
	Sixth Amendment
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS,
	Univar USA Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) sponsors and maintains the Univar USA Inc. Supplemental Retirement Plan, as amended and restated effective July&nbsp;1, 2004 and as thereafter amended (the &#147;Plan&#148;); and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, as a result of the merger of CHEMCENTRAL Corporation (&#147;CHEMCENTRAL&#148;) into the Company (with the Company being the surviving
	entity) effective October&nbsp;1, 2007, the Company became sponsor of the employee benefit plans that were sponsored by CHEMCENTRAL, including the CHEMCENTRAL Corporation Consolidated Retirement Plan, as amended and restated effective
	January&nbsp;1, 1999 and as thereafter amended (the &#147;LCC Plan&#148;); and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, effective January&nbsp;1, 2008, the LCC Plan is
	merging with and into the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan, as amended and restated effective January&nbsp;1, 2007 (the &#147;Univar Retirement Plan&#148;) with the Univar Retirement Plan being the surviving plan and the provisions of the LCC Plan
	becoming Appendix T to the Univar Retirement Plan; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company has the authority to amend the Plan pursuant to
	Section&nbsp;10 of the Plan; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company desires to amend the Plan to provide that no individuals accruing a benefit or with
	accrued benefits under Appendix T of the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan shall accrue a benefit under the Plan;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	NOW, THEREFORE,
	Section&nbsp;3 of the Plan,
<U>
	Participation
</U>
	, is hereby amended by adding a new paragraph to the end thereof to read, effective January&nbsp;1, 2008, as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#147;Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, no individual accruing (or with accrued) benefits under
	Appendix T of the Retirement Plan shall accrue a benefit or otherwise be a Participant in this Plan.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Sixth Amendment is
	executed this 19
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day of December, 2007.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage292"></A>
<A NAME="D88742DEX1036_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_13"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.36
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	UNIVAR USA INC. SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(As Amended and Restated Effective July&nbsp;1, 2004)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<U>
	Seventh Amendment
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, Univar USA Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) sponsors and maintains the Univar USA Inc. Supplemental Retirement Plan, as amended and
	restated effective July&nbsp;1, 2004 and as thereafter amended (the &#147;Plan&#148;); and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, Appendix B sets forth special rules
	regarding additional age and service credit for Patrick D. Tole (&#147;Executive&#148;) in the event Univar Inc. terminates his employment for reasons other than Cause or Total Disability or he voluntarily terminates his employment for Good Reason
	in the absence of Cause, provided such termination occurs within 24 months after a change in control of Univar Inc.; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, for
	purposes of Appendix B and the employment agreement between Executive and Univar Inc., a change in control of Univar Inc. occurred on October&nbsp;11, 2007; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company has the authority to amend the Plan pursuant to Section&nbsp;10 of the Plan; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company desires to amend the portion of Appendix B of the Plan applicable to Executive to revise the terms of Executive&#146;s
	additional age and service credit, the time benefit payments commence and the form of benefit payment;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	NOW, THEREFORE, the Plan is hereby
	amended as follows, effective as of the date this Amendment is executed:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1. The first paragraph that immediately follows
	Section&nbsp;5(d) of the Plan,
<U>
	Benefit Amount
</U>
	, is amended in its entirety to read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding the
	above in this Section&nbsp;5 of the Plan or the provisions of this Plan regarding the form and timing of distribution of Plan benefits, Univar USA Inc. may amend the Plan at any time to provide different formulas and terms for determining the amount
	of benefit a Participant accrues under this Plan, as well as the terms regarding form and timing of benefit payment under this Plan, and such different formulas and terms may result in more or less benefits being accrued by such Participant than
	what would be accrued under the terms above in this Section&nbsp;5 above, and for payment being commenced and paid at a time and in a form different than otherwise provided in the body of this Plan document. Any change in the formulas and terms that
	result (or may result) in a reduction in benefits already accrued by a Participant under the Plan at the time the amendment is adopted must be consented to by the Participant. The different formulas and terms that apply to a Participant shall be set
	forth in Appendix B hereto.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage293"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2. The following sentence is added to the end of the second paragraph of Appendix B:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following shall also set forth special rules for the Participants set forth below regarding the form and timing of payment of their Plan
	benefits.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3. The section of Appendix B of the Plan relating to Executive is hereby amended in its entirety to read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Patrick D. Tole
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If Univar Inc. terminates Mr.&nbsp;Tole&#146;s employment other than for Cause or Total Disability, or if Mr.&nbsp;Tole
	(&#147;Executive&#148;) terminates Executive&#146;s employment for Good Reason in the absence of Cause (as defined in his employment agreement with Univar Inc. dated February&nbsp;19, 2003, as amended effective April&nbsp;11, 2006,&nbsp;May&nbsp;9,
	2006,&nbsp;October&nbsp;11, 2007 and June&nbsp;10, 2008, hereinafter &#147;Employment Agreement&#148;), or if Executive&#146;s employment with Univar Inc. terminates due to his death, and if such termination occurs no later than October&nbsp;10,
	2009 and Executive satisfies the release condition set forth in the first sentence of Section&nbsp;5.2 of his Employment Agreement, Executive&#146;s retirement benefit under this Plan shall be determined using the following age and service credits
	and paid at the time and in the form described in the following paragraph:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Executive&#146;s retirement benefit under this
	Plan shall be determined as if Executive were age 55 plus the number of whole months between April&nbsp;1, 2008 and the date of his actual termination of employment and Executive had credited service as if he had worked for Univar Inc. until
	attaining age 55 plus the number of whole months between April&nbsp;1, 2008 and the date of his actual termination of employment. Monthly benefit payments under this Plan shall commence on the later of January&nbsp;1, 2009 or the first day of the
	month after Executive terminates employment with Univar Inc. and shall be payable in the form of annuity (e.g., single life annuity, 100% joint and survivor annuity) irrevocably elected by Executive with respect to his Plan benefit prior to the
	earlier of December&nbsp;31, 2008 or the date of his termination of employment with Univar Inc. The timing and form of benefit commencing on the later of January&nbsp;1, 2009 or the first day of the month after Executive terminates employment with
	Univar Inc. shall apply to Executive&#146;s entire accrued benefit under this Plan (including amounts accrued prior to January&nbsp;1, 2005), and such timing and form shall not be tied to the timing and form of benefit payments from the Univar USA
	Inc. Retirement Plan (&#147;US Pension&#148;). Commencing on the later of January&nbsp;1, 2009 or the first day of the month after Executive terminates employment with Univar Inc. and ending with the month in which Executive actually turns age 55
	(or, if earlier, upon his death), monthly payments from this Plan shall include amounts that would have been payable per month from the US Pension had Executive been age 55 and commenced receiving benefit payments from that plan on the later of
	January&nbsp;1, 2009 or the first day of the month after Executive terminates employment with Univar Inc. in the form of annuity irrevocably elected by Executive with respect to his Plan benefit prior to the earlier of his termination of employment
	with Univar Inc. or December&nbsp;31, 2008. Executive agrees that his benefit payments under the
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage294"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	US Pension shall not commence prior to the earlier of his death or the first of the month following his attainment of age 55. In the event Executive fails to make a timely election of the form of
	annuity payment of his Plan benefit, such benefit shall be paid in the form of a 100% joint and survivor annuity with his spouse as joint annuitant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event Executive&#146;s employment with Univar Inc. terminates and Executive is not entitled to have his Plan benefit
	amount, timing and form determined pursuant to the immediately preceding paragraph (e.g., the termination occurs after October&nbsp;10, 2009), Executive&#146;s Plan benefit shall be calculated and paid as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Executive&#146;s benefit under this Plan shall be calculated based on his actual age and credited service at the time benefit
	payments commence from this Plan (without any additions of age or service credit for periods of time after his termination of employment). Benefit payments from this Plan (including amounts accrued and vested as of December&nbsp;31, 2004 as well as
	amounts that are accrued or become vested thereafter) shall commence on the first day of the month following the later of his termination of employment with Univar Inc. or attainment of age 55, and shall be payable in the form of annuity (e.g.,
	single life annuity, 100% joint and survivor annuity) irrevocably elected by Executive with respect to his Plan benefit prior to the earlier of December&nbsp;31, 2008 or the date of his termination of employment with Univar Inc. In the event
	Executive fails to make a timely election of the form of annuity payment of his Plan benefit, such benefit shall be paid in the form of a 100% joint and survivor annuity with his spouse as joint annuitant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Seventh Amendment is executed this 19
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day of June, 2008.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="D88742DEX1037_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_14"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.37
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	UNIVAR USA INC. SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(As Amended and Restated Effective July&nbsp;1, 2004)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<U>
	Eighth Amendment
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, Univar USA Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) sponsors and maintains the Univar USA Inc. Supplemental Retirement Plan, as amended and
	restated effective July&nbsp;1, 2004 and as thereafter amended (the &#147;Plan&#148;); and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Plan provides supplemental
	retirement benefits to certain individuals who participate in the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan (other than Appendix T of such plan); and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company also sponsors and maintains the Chemcentral Corporation Retirement Benefit Replacement Plan (&#147;Chemcentral
	Plan&#148;); and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Chemcentral Plan provides supplemental retirement benefits to certain individuals who participate in
	Appendix T of the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company desires to merge the Chemcentral Plan into the Plan (with the
	Plan being the surviving plan) effective December&nbsp;31, 2008; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company desires to clarify (and in the case of the
	benefits under the Chemcentral Plan, amend) the timing of benefit distributions consistent with the requirements of Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company desires to amend the Plan to reflect the additional prior service credit granted to Richard Orth; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company has the authority to amend the Plan pursuant to Section&nbsp;10 of the Plan and to amend the Chemcentral Plan pursuant to
	Section&nbsp;5 of the Chemcentral Plan;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	NOW, THEREFORE, effective December&nbsp;31, 2008, the Chemcentral Plan is hereby merged into the
	Plan with the Plan being the surviving plan; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	FURTHERMORE, effective December&nbsp;31, 2008, the Plan is hereby amended as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1. The Plan is hereby amended to change the phrase &#147;as soon as practicable&#148; to read &#147;as soon as practicable (and in no
	event later than 90 days)&#148; in each case where such phrase occurs. The foregoing does not apply to Appendix F where the phrase &#147;as soon as practicable&#148; is already followed by such parenthetical.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage296"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2. Section&nbsp;1 of the Plan,
<U>
	Purpose
</U>
	, is hereby amended by adding the following
	paragraph to the end thereof:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, to the extent set forth in Appendix F hereto, this Plan shall pay benefits to
	certain individuals with accrued benefits under Appendix T of the Retirement Plan. Such individuals shall not accrue any benefits under portions of this Plan other than Appendix F, and only the provisions of Appendix F, the last paragraph of
	Section&nbsp;8, and Sections 9 through 18 of this Plan shall apply to their benefits hereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3. The last paragraph of Section&nbsp;3
	of the Plan,
<U>
	Participation
</U>
	, is hereby amended in its entirety to read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding any other
	provision of the Plan to the contrary, no individual accruing (or with accrued) benefits under Appendix T of the Retirement Plan shall accrue a benefit or otherwise be a Participant in this Plan except as provided in Appendix F hereto. Any vested
	benefits accrued under Appendix F shall be determined and paid in accordance only with the provisions of Appendix F, the last paragraph of Section&nbsp;8, and Sections 9 through 18 of this Plan, and not in accordance with any other provisions of the
	Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4. The following sentence is added to the end of the first paragraph of Section&nbsp;5 that immediately follows Section&nbsp;5(d)
	of the Plan,
<U>
	Benefit Amount
</U>
	, and to the second paragraph of Appendix B of the Plan, DIFFERENT BENEFIT FORMULAS AND TERMS FOR CERTAIN PARTICIPANTS:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding the foregoing, no amendment to Appendix B can be adopted after December&nbsp;31, 2008 that would change the form or timing of
	payment of benefits under this Plan except to the extent such amendment complies with Code Section&nbsp;409A and the regulations thereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	5. Section&nbsp;8 of the Plan,
<U>
	Date and Form of Payment
</U>
	, is hereby amended by adding the following paragraph to the end thereof:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In this Plan (including, without limitation, Appendix F), the phrase &#147;as soon as practicable (and in no event later than
	90 days)&#148; means that a vested Plan benefit will be paid or commenced as soon as the administrator of the Plan can practicably get such payment made or commenced (but in no event later than 90 days), and the Participant or Beneficiary shall have
	no ability to control or influence when during that 90 day period the payment is made. In the event such 90 day period crosses from one calendar year to the next, the Participant or Beneficiary shall have no ability to designate the calendar year in
	which the payment will be made. For example, where the Plan says a benefit payment will be made or commenced &#147;as soon as practicable&#148; after a Participant&#146;s separation from service, the benefit will be paid or commenced no later than
	90 days after the Participant&#146;s separation from service.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage297"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	6 Appendix B of the Plan,
<B>
	Different Benefits Formulas and Terms for Certain Participants
</B>
	,
	is amended to add the following language to the end thereof:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Richard D. Orth
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In calculating Mr.&nbsp;Orth&#146;s benefits under this Plan (i.e., for purposes of the calculation under Plan
	Section&nbsp;5(a) but not 5(b)), he shall be treated as if he had twenty-one (21)&nbsp;additional years of credited service for purposes of calculating his accrued benefit under the Plan (to reflect Richard D. Orth&#146;s additional service credit
	granted pursuant to his employment agreement with Univar when it acquired Olympic Chemical Corporation).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	7. The first sentence of
	Appendix C, Benefits for Canadian Plan Participants, is amended in its entirety to read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To the extent that,
	due to its insolvency or other financial or legal impediment, Univar Canada Ltd. cannot and does not pay a Canadian Plan Participant a benefit payment that is due and owing to the Canadian Plan Participant under the Canadian Plan, such payment shall
	be made under this Plan within the time period when such payment would have been made by Univar Canada Ltd. under the Canadian Plan had Univar Canada Ltd. been able to make the payment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	8. The Plan is hereby amended by adding a new Appendix F to the end of the Plan to read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	APPENDIX F
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	BENEFITS FOR
	CERTAIN INDIVIDUALS WITH ACCRUED BENEFITS UNDER
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	APPENDIX T OF THE RETIREMENT PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(
</B>
<B>
<I>
	The Former CHEMCENTRAL Corporation Consolidated Retirement Plan
</I>
</B>
<B>
	)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.
<U>
	Participation
</U>
	. Participants with accrued benefits in the Chemcentral Corporation Retirement Benefit Replacement Plan (&#147;Chemcentral Plan&#148;)
	as of December&nbsp;31, 2008 shall have such accrued benefits (to the extent they are or become vested) paid through this Univar USA Inc. Supplemental Retirement Plan (&#147;Plan&#148;) in accordance with this Appendix F. In addition, this Plan
	shall provide benefits to any participant in the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan (&#147;Retirement Plan&#148;) who accrues a benefit after December&nbsp;31, 2008 under Appendix T of the Retirement Plan and whose benefit under Appendix T of the
	Retirement Plan (i)&nbsp;is impacted (i.e., limited) by Sections 401(a)(17) (the annual compensation limit) or 415 (the maximum annual benefit limit) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (&#147;Code&#148;), or (ii)&nbsp;is calculated
	without taking into account deferrals of compensation under the Chemcentral Executive Deferral Compensation Plan prior to January&nbsp;1, 2008, or (iii)&nbsp;did not include prior service with Southwest Solvent pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.3(f)(iii)
	of Appendix T because the individual was considered a highly compensated employee under Code Section&nbsp;414(q). The foregoing shall be considered Participants in the Plan for purposes of this Appendix F, the last paragraph of Section&nbsp;8, and
	Sections 9 through 18 of the Plan. Any vested benefits accrued under this Appendix F shall be determined and paid in accordance only with the provisions of Appendix F, the last paragraph of
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage298"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Section&nbsp;8, and Sections 9 through 18 of this Plan, and not in accordance with any other provisions of the Plan (e.g., Sections 1 through 9 or Appendices A through E). The benefits provided
	under this Appendix F are subject to Code Section&nbsp;409A, and the provisions of this Appendix F shall be interpreted consistent with the requirements of Code Section&nbsp;409A and the regulations thereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2.
<U>
	Benefit Accruals
</U>
	. A Participant&#146;s defined benefit pension replacement benefit shall be equal to the excess of: (i)&nbsp;the
	amount of retirement benefit which otherwise would have been provided for him (or in the event of his death, his beneficiary) under Appendix T of the Retirement Plan, determined without regard to the limitations of Code Sections 401(a)(17) and 415
	(and by taking into account any amounts deferred prior to January&nbsp;1, 2008 under the Chemcentral Executive Deferral Compensation Plan); over (ii)&nbsp;the amount of retirement benefit actually provided for the Participant or his beneficiary
	under Appendix T of the Retirement Plan. For purposes of determining a Participant&#146;s defined benefit pension replacement benefit under this Section&nbsp;2, the amount of retirement benefit calculated under subsection (i)&nbsp;above shall be
	determined taking into account the additional service that would have been credited to him under Section&nbsp;3.3(f) of Appendix T of the Retirement Plan if Section&nbsp;3.3(f)(iii) did not apply.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.
<U>
	Vesting in Benefits
</U>
	. A Participant (or his or her beneficiary) shall only be vested in and entitled to receive a benefit from this
	Plan to the extent the Participant is vested in his or her benefits accrued under Appendix T of the Retirement Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4.
<U>
	Beneficiary
</U>
	. A Participant may from time to time designate a beneficiary for his or her vested benefits under the Plan (&#147;Beneficiary&#148;) to whom such vested benefits will be paid in the event of his or her death before complete
	distribution of such vested benefits. The Participant shall designate the Beneficiary by completing and submitting a form or using an electronic designation method acceptable to Univar and its outside Plan administrator. The designation must be
	submitted prior to the Participant&#146;s death to be valid. In the absence of an effective designation or if a designated Beneficiary does not survive the Participant, the Participant&#146;s Beneficiary shall be his or her estate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	5.
<U>
	Calculation and Payment of Benefits
</U>
	. Except as provided in Sections 6 and 7 below, Payment of vested benefits accrued under this
	Appendix F shall be paid in seven substantially equal annual installments to the Participant (or, in the case of a Participant&#146;s death, his or her Beneficiary) commencing as soon as practicable (and in no event later than 90 days) after the
	earlier of the date the Participant dies or separates from service with Univar USA Inc. and its affiliates. The first installment shall be paid as soon as practicable (and in no event later than 90 days) after the Participant dies or separates from
	service with Univar USA Inc. and its affiliates (whichever occurs first), and subsequent installments shall be paid on the successive six annual anniversaries of the date the Participant separated from service or died (whichever occurred first). The
	installments shall be substantially equal, and the actuarial lump sum present value of the installment payments as of the date the first installment is to be paid shall equal the actuarial lump sum present value on such commencement date of the
	Participant&#146;s vested accrued benefit as determined under Sections 1 and 2 above. The actuarial factors used to calculate actuarial equivalencies in order to determine the amount of the installment payments (or, in the case of payments under
	Section&nbsp;6 below, the amount of a lump sum payment) shall be a discount rate of 8.00%&nbsp;per year and applicable mortality table under Code Section&nbsp;417(e)(3)(A)(ii)(I).
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage299"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	6.
<U>
	Elections Prior to 2009 For Lump Sum Payments
</U>
	. Notwithstanding the foregoing,
	Participants with vested Plan benefits who separated from service prior to January&nbsp;1, 2009 and prior to January&nbsp;1, 2009 elected to receive their first of 7 annual installments in 2008 and the actuarially equivalent present value of their
	remaining 6 installments in January 2009 shall receive their first 1/7
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	installment by December&nbsp;31, 2008 and the actuarially equivalent present value of their six remaining installments in
	January 2009. Participants with vested Plan benefits who were employed with Univar USA Inc. or an affiliate thereof on December&nbsp;31, 2008 and prior to January&nbsp;1, 2009 elected to receive their vested Plan benefits in the form of a single
	actuarially equivalent lump sum shall receive such lump sum payment as soon as practicable (and in no event later than 90 days) after they separate from service with Univar USA Inc. and its affiliates. In the event of the Participant&#146;s death
	prior to receipt of the lump sum payment of vested benefits described in this Section&nbsp;6, such lump sum shall be paid to the Participant&#146;s Beneficiary as soon as practicable (and in no event later than 90 days) after the Participant&#146;s
	death.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	7.
<U>
	Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;409A
</U>
	. For purposes of this Plan, &#147;separation from service&#148; shall have the
	same meaning as under Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(A)(i). Notwithstanding anything in this Plan to the contrary, in the event the Participant is considered a &#147;specified employee&#148; subject to the required six month delay in benefit payments
	under Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i), then any benefits that would otherwise be paid under this Plan as a result of the Participant&#146;s separation from service (as opposed to death) within the first six (6)&nbsp;months after such
	Participant&#146;s separation from service shall be paid in a single lump sum on (or within 15 days after) the six month anniversary of the Participant&#146;s separation from service. After such six month anniversary, the Participant&#146;s
	installment payments shall be made on the normal schedule.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	8.
<U>
	Tax Withholding
</U>
	. Payments under this Plan shall be reduced for
	applicable tax withholdings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Eighth Amendment is executed this 23
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	rd
</SUP>
	day of
	December, 2008.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_15"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.38
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	UNIVAR USA INC. SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(As Amended and Restated Effective July&nbsp;1, 2004)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<U>
	Ninth Amendment
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS,
	Univar USA Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) sponsors and maintains the Univar USA Inc. Supplemental Retirement Plan, as amended and restated effective July&nbsp;1, 2004 and as thereafter amended (the &#147;Plan&#148;); and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company desires to amend the Plan to reflect the freeze of accrued benefits and cessation of benefit accruals on
	December&nbsp;31, 2009 for all active participants under the Univar USA Inc. Retirement Plan; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	NOW, THEREFORE, effective
	December&nbsp;31, 2009, Section&nbsp;3 of the Plan,
<U>
	Participation
</U>
	, is hereby amended by adding the following new paragraph to the end thereof:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#147;Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, effective December&nbsp;31, 2009, accrued benefits under
	this Plan are frozen for those Participants whose benefits under the Retirement Plan are frozen as of December&nbsp;31, 2009 pursuant to the terms of the Retirement Plan (including, without limitation, the terms of Appendix T of the Retirement
	Plan), and no additional benefits shall accrue for such Participants under this Plan after December&nbsp;31, 2009.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Ninth
	Amendment is executed this 21
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	st
</SUP>
	day of December, 2009.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_16"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.47
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	June&nbsp;23, 2015
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Clayton, Dubilier&nbsp;&amp; Rice, LLC
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	375 Park Avenue, 18
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	&nbsp;Floor
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	New York, NY 10152
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Facsimile: (212)&nbsp;407-5252
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Attention: Theresa Gore
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Ladies and Gentlemen:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Reference is made to the Consulting Agreement, dated as of November&nbsp;30, 2010 (the &#147;
<U>
	CD&amp;R Consulting Agreement
</U>
	&#148;),
	among Univar Inc. (the &#147;
<U>
	Company
</U>
	&#148;), Univar USA Inc. (&#147;
<U>
	Opco
</U>
	&#148;) and Clayton, Dubilier&nbsp;&amp; Rice, LLC (&#147;
<U>
	CD&amp;R
</U>
	&#148;). Capitalized terms used but not defined herein shall have the meanings ascribed to
	them in the CD&amp;R Consulting Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Upon the terms and conditions of this letter agreement, the parties hereby agree to terminate
	the CD&amp;R Consulting Agreement pursuant to Section&nbsp;4(c) thereof, in connection with the Company&#146;s initial public offering of shares of its common stock pursuant to the Company&#146;s Registration Statement on Form S-1 (Registration
	No.&nbsp;333-197085) (the &#147;
<U>
	IPO
</U>
	&#148;). In connection with and as consideration for such termination, the Company and Opco, jointly and severally, agree to pay in cash a fee of $13.1 million to CD&amp;R (the &#147;
<U>
	CD&amp;R Termination
	Fee
</U>
	&#148;) on the closing date of the Company&#146;s IPO and, in consideration thereof, CD&amp;R will waive any right to any Transaction Fee in connection with the IPO. Upon the payment of the CD&amp;R Termination Fee, the CD&amp;R Consulting
	Agreement will terminate,&nbsp;
<U>
	provided
</U>
	&nbsp;that Section&nbsp;3 thereof shall survive solely as to any portion of any Consulting Fee, Transaction Fee or Expenses accrued, but not paid or reimbursed, prior to such termination. The termination
	of the CD&amp;R Consulting Agreement shall not affect the Indemnification Agreement which shall survive such termination.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The CD&amp;R
	Consulting Agreement is being terminated in reliance upon, and subject to, the concurrent termination of the Monitoring Agreement, dated as of November&nbsp;30, 2010, among the Company, Opco and CVC Capital Partners Advisory Company (Luxembourg)
	S.&agrave;.r.l., and the Implementation and Facilitation Agreement, dated as of November&nbsp;30, 2010, among the Company, Opco and each of CVC European Equity IV (AB) Limited, CVC European Equity IV (CDE) Limited and CVC European Equity Tandem GP
	Limited, in consideration of a fee in an amount equal to the CD&amp;R Termination Fee and on terms substantially identical to this letter agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This letter agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, with each executed counterpart constituting an original, but all together
	one and the same instrument. This letter agreement sets forth the entire understanding and agreement
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage302"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	among the parties with respect to the transactions contemplated herein and supersedes and replaces any prior understanding, agreement or statement of intent, in each case written or oral, of any
	kind and every nature with respect hereto. This letter agreement is governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York applicable to agreements made and to be performed within that state.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">

	[Remainder of the page left intentionally blank.]
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	If the foregoing is in accordance with your understanding and agreement, please sign and return
	this letter agreement, whereupon this letter agreement shall constitute a binding agreement with respect to the matters set forth herein.
</P>

	CVC European Equity Tandem GP Limited
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	22 Grenville Street

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	St Helier, Jersey JE4 8PX
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Channel Islands
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Attention: Carl Hansen
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Ladies and Gentlemen:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Reference is made to the
	Implementation and Facilitation Agreement, dated as of November&nbsp;30, 2010 (the &#147;
<U>
	CVC Implementation and Facilitation Agreement
</U>
	&#148;) among the Univar Inc. (the &#147;
<U>
	Company
</U>
	&#148;), Univar USA Inc. (&#147;
<U>
	Opco
</U>
	&#148;)
	and each of CVC European Equity IV (AB) Limited, CVC European Equity IV (CDE) Limited and CVC European Equity Tandem GP Limited (together the &#147;
<U>
	CVC Managers
</U>
	&#148;). Capitalized terms used but not defined herein shall have the meanings
	ascribed to them in the CVC Implementation and Facilitation Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Upon the terms and conditions of this letter agreement, the
	parties hereby agree to terminate the CVC Implementation and Facilitation Agreement pursuant to Section&nbsp;4(c) thereof, in connection with the Company&#146;s initial public offering of shares of its common stock pursuant to the Company&#146;s
	Registration Statement on Form S-1 (Registration No.&nbsp;333-197085) (the &#147;
<U>
	IPO
</U>
	&#148;). Reference is made to the Monitoring Agreement, dated November&nbsp;30, 2010 (the &#147;
<U>
	CVC Monitoring Agreement
</U>
	&#148;) among the Company, Opco
	and CVC Capital Partners Advisory Company (Luxembourg) S.&agrave;.r.l (&#147;
<U>
	CVC
</U>
	&#148;). In connection with and as consideration for termination of the CVC Implementation and Facilitation Agreement and the CVC Monitoring Agreement, the
	Company and Opco, jointly and severally, agree to pay in cash a fee of $13.1 million to CVC (the &#147;
<U>
	CVC Termination Fee
</U>
	&#148;), on the closing date of the Company&#146;s IPO and, in consideration thereof, the CVC Managers will waive any
	right to any Facilitation and Implementation Fee in connection with the IPO. Upon the payment of the CVC Termination Fee, the CVC Implementation
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage305"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	and Facilitation Agreement will terminate,&nbsp;
<U>
	provided
</U>
	&nbsp;that Section&nbsp;3 thereof shall survive solely as to any portion of any Facilitation and Implementation Fee or Expenses
	accrued, but not paid or reimbursed, prior to such termination. The termination of the CVC Implementation and Facilitation Agreement shall not affect the Indemnification Agreement which shall survive such termination.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The CVC Implementation and Facilitation Agreement is being terminated in reliance upon, and subject to, the concurrent termination of
	(i)&nbsp;the Consulting Agreement, dated as of November&nbsp;30, 2010, among the Company, Opco and Clayton, Dubilier&nbsp;&amp; Rice, LLC, in consideration of a fee in an amount equal to the CVC Termination Fee and on terms substantially identical
	to this letter agreement, and (ii)&nbsp;the CVC Monitoring Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This letter agreement may be executed in any number of
	counterparts, with each executed counterpart constituting an original, but all together one and the same instrument. This letter agreement sets forth the entire understanding and agreement among the parties with respect to the transactions
	contemplated herein and supersedes and replaces any prior understanding, agreement or statement of intent, in each case written or oral, of any kind and every nature with respect hereto. This letter agreement is governed by and construed in
	accordance with the laws of the State of New York applicable to agreements made and to be performed within that state.
</P>
